Question
========

The distribution of the number of children per family in the U.S. has a mean of 0.9 and a standard deviation of 1.1. If you take a random sample of 20 families in the U.S., what is the probability that there are a total of 40 or fewer children in the sample? (z is normally distributed by default).

Answerlist
----------

* P(z ≤ 1.5)
* P(z ≤ 6.3)
* P(z ≥ 6.3)
* P(z = 6.3)
* P(z ≤ 40)

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* P(z ≤ 1.5): Incorrect
* P(z ≤ 6.3): Correct
* P(z ≥ 6.3): Incorrect
* P(z = 6.3): Incorrect
* P(z ≤ 40): Incorrect
